q: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . "He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure," Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself. Mike Pence had been considering possible 2012 campaigns for governor or president and had said he would announce his decision by the end of this month. letter to supporters Thursday, Mike Pence said he and his family feel led to devote this time in our lives to continuing to serve the people of Indiana in some way. "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012," he said.
